name: GHK-Cu
overview: A copper-binding peptide naturally found in human plasma, saliva, and urine. It has been extensively studied for skin health and wound healing, with some topical formulations available commercially.
interactions_notes: May interact with copper supplements or medications affecting copper metabolism. Generally well-tolerated topically. Discuss with clinician if using other copper-containing products.
dosing_ranges_literature: Topical formulations typically use 0.05-2% concentrations. Subcutaneous injection protocols in research have varied from 1-10 mg, but topical use is more common and established.
storage_notes: Store unreconstituted peptide in freezer (-20Â°C or colder). After reconstitution, store refrigerated and use within 2-3 weeks. Protect from light.
